name: xorneg

stmt.origin: bitr4i(wxo(wn(w0), wn(w1)), wxo(w0, w1), wn(wxo(w0, wn(w1))))

body.origin:
|- wb(wxo(wn(w0), wn(w1)), wxo(w0, w1))
-| wb(wxo(wn(w0), wn(w1)), wn(wxo(w0, wn(w1))))
-| wb(wxo(w0, w1), wn(wxo(w0, wn(w1))))

cumulated.origin:
|- wb(wxo(wn(w0), wn(w1)), wxo(w0, w1))
-| wb(wxo(wn(w0), wn(w1)), wn(wxo(w0, wn(w1))))
-| wb(wxo(w0, w1), wn(wxo(w0, wn(w1))))

|- wb(wxo(wn(w0), wn(w1)), wxo(w0, w1))
-| wb(wxo(w0, w1), wn(wxo(w0, wn(w1))))

body.origin:
|- wb(wxo(w0, w1), wn(wxo(w0, wn(w1))))
-| wb(wxo(w0, wn(w1)), wn(wxo(w0, w1)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wb(wxo(wn(w0), wn(w1)), wxo(w0, w1))
-| wb(wxo(w0, wn(w1)), wn(wxo(w0, w1)))

comment: The connector ` \/_ ` is unchanged under negation of both arguments. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 4-Sep-2016.)
